Nothing special should be required to 'install' the commons-pool JAR; it 
should be pulled by Maven2 just the same as every other 3rd-party-library.

Which Java are you using? Sun Java 1.5+ is recommended; GCJ usually runs 
into problems, sooner or later.

- Gordon @ IA

gkbrown22 wrote:
> I have just migrated to a new system. It's OS is FC7. When I try and
> build heritrix2 from the source I get this error:
> 
> FairGenericObjectPool.java:[17,31] cannot find symbol
> symbol  : class PoolableObjectFactory
> location: package org.apache.commons.pool
> 
> I have 'installed' the org.apache.commons.pool jar into my repo but
> this  doesn't resolve anything.
